title: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, January 1, 2014
byline: Adam Ragusea, Bruce Johnson, D Gorenstein, David Brancaccio, David Gura and Nancy Marshall-Genzer
teaser: Today is the first day of health insurance coverage for people who have signed up for Obamacare. More than two million people are now covered by insurance, and millions more by Medicaid. Also, the North American Free Trade Agreement came into force twenty years ago today. NAFTA created the world's largest free trade zone, and a lot of controversy. Then-President Bill Clinton promised more jobs, while folks like billionaire businessman Ross Perot warned NAFTA would push jobs south.
